--- title: Longus colli cervicis --- ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Longus colli cervicis C5-T3 Anterior surface of vertebral body C2-C4 Anterior surface Anterior rami
C2 - C6		 Unilateral: C/L sidebend, C/L rotation
Bilateral: Forward flexion
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - C5-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - C3-C5 (TP, Ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - T1-T3 (ant side of vertebral body) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Vertical (medial) part: C2-C4 (ant sides of vertebral bodies) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 Superior oblique part: C1 (TP, ant tubercle) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 Inferior oblique part: C5-C6 (TP, Ant tubercles) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} Direct branches from cervical plexus (C2-C6) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Bilateral**: Flex AO Joint - **Unilateral**: Lat flex at AO joint # Muscle groups Longus colli cervicis is part of the [prevertebral muscle group]({{< var ref-oians.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020. # Palpation # Clinical significance
